heading: Definition
text:
As used in this article, the following term shall have the following meaning:

   RETAINING WALL. A wall that resists lateral pressures and limits lateral displacement caused by soil, rock, water or other
   materials, except that basement and vault walls that are part of a building, underground structures, including but not limited to
   utility vault structures, tunnels, transit stations and swimming pools, shall not be considered retaining walls.
